definition: to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: They were moved to tears by his honesty.
sentences.chinese: 他们为他的诚实感动得落下了眼泪。

sentences.english: Oh yeah, I was moved by him.
Watching, I was moved almost to tears.
sentences.chinese: 此情此景让我感动得几乎落泪。

sentences.english: The true feelings reveal, here two are redundant is how could it not be more moving? Also for example.
sentences.chinese: 真情流露，这里的两个重复岂不更令人感动？又如。

sentences.english: We are not impressed by sea cucumber chivalry。
sentences.chinese: 我们并不会被海参骑士精神所感动。

sentences.english: I was deeply affected by the news.
I was touched by the culture belt between China and Japan.
sentences.chinese: 中日的文化有着如此紧密的联系使我感动不已。

sentences.english: We whelm with tears at this time.
sentences.chinese: 我们在这个时刻不由得感动泪流。

sentences.english: Each time I'm moved to tears.
I remember being thoroughly impressed by Radian.
sentences.chinese: 我记得我彻底地被Radian感动。

sentences.english: The speech deeply affected the audience.
sentences.chinese: 这次演讲使观众们深为感动。

sentences.english: People who get into top colleges have deep interests they love to talk about, maybe a little too much even.
sentences.chinese: 特别是名校的学生，一说到这个甚至会有点感动过甚。

sentences.english: All of them are also sympathized about their friends in other schools who did not receive such materials.
sentences.chinese: 他们对其他学校没有得到这些物品感动惋惜。

sentences.english: Through the Spirit they urged Paul not to go on to Jerusalem.
sentences.chinese: 他们被圣灵感动，对保罗说，不要上耶路撒冷去。

sentences.english: The TV placdfds. com made her moved.
sentences.chinese: 这部电视剧令她非常感动。

sentences.english: Deeply moved by the story, the excited people stopped quarrelling with each other.
sentences.chinese: 激动的人们被那个故事深深地感动了，停止了争吵。

definition: eyes brimming with tears of excitement (idiom)/extremely moved
